subject: Re: [junit] How to test a main(String[] args) method?
msgSnippet: ... True enough. Momentary annoyance. ... In that case, I can see where the System bridge is a reasonable idea. I still want to hurt someone, though.... J. B.
messageBody:
>So said Mike Clark on 2003-07-29 --------------------
>J. B. Rainsberger wrote:
>
>>>So said bernd on 2003-07-29 --------------------
>>
>>>- you cannot simply move the code in this case because the calls to exit
>>> are scattered around, you would also have to replace the exit calls
>>> with e.g. return SomeExitCode;
>>
>>
>> Scattered around where? Who the hell thought that was a good idea?!
>>
>
>What does it matter now who scattered the code? What's done is done.

True enough. Momentary annoyance.

>If I'm in this situation, and I'm reading the situation correctly, then
>I'm afraid. Not stuck, just afraid. I want to test code that's
>scattered, but now I'm being told to move the code, but I don't have
>tests to let me safely move the code. Rock meets hard place. So the
>best I can do is write the tests I can -- any way I can -- then address
>the duplication.

In that case, I can see where the System bridge is a reasonable idea.

I still want to hurt someone, though....
